website_summaries.verdict: A garden within easy reach that’s suitable for wheelchair users or older individuals. Perfect for balcony gardening.
pros: The compact Veg Trug design provides a surprising amount of growing space
The unique V-shaped bed can be used to grow shallow and deep-rooted veggies
Wood is treated with a food-safe substance to prevent premature rot
cons: Once you pick a spot and fill your VegTrug, it’s nearly impossible to move the massive wooden structure

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Purchase
customer_reviews.text: I searched high and low for a raised garden bed on legs. This has everything I wanted, tall height, food safe materials, treated wood, large size with good depth. This took 9, 35L bags of organic garden potting soil. The box and one of the wooden boards was damaged upon arrival but the scratched and dented part of the board ending up facing inwards. I did not tuck in the lining as shown but left it out. While assembling watch the YouTube video instead of the reading the instructions enclosed, MUCH easier! Can't wait to see the end results of my planting later in the season!
customer_reviews.author: AAFP/S

customer_reviews.title: Don't Bother
customer_reviews.text: I was so disappointed when I received this. It is made in China and the wood is substandard. 2 boards were badly cracked and a third board was completely split. (See attached photos) I'm sure it would fall apart further upon assembly. It's being returned.
customer_reviews.author: California-Girl

customer_reviews.title: The BEST investment ever
customer_reviews.text: The BEST investment ever!! It was so easy to put together and my garden is growing so well. It has been 6 weeks since I planted my tomatoes and I'm happy to say I have over 70 tomatoes (5 plants)!! I want another one for next year!! LOVE LOVE LOVE IT.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Reichenberger

customer_reviews.title: No Bending Over!
customer_reviews.text: This bed came with a liner, and was easy to assemble. The legs have steel caps on them to protect the wood. It was a little "yellow" in color, so I stained it in about an hour and it looks fabulous! I love that the planting area is waist high (I'm 5'2") but has a deep V to encourage deep roots. You can build this and fill it with soil in an afternoon.
customer_reviews.author: Doris M.

customer_reviews.title: Great for gardeners with mobility issues.
customer_reviews.text: This was just what I was looking for. I bought this for a friend who loves gardening, but has mobility issues. I didn’t run into the problems other reviewers did. It went together easily. I did have one board split, so don’t over tighten. I’ve only had it a couple of months, so hopefully it holds up.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: The best planter
customer_reviews.text: This planter is very well designed. You can put large plants like tomatoes is the middle and herbs and other not so large plants on the sides. Every thing we have planted is growing very well. We use all of our herbs daily . Also the planter box itself looks great in our backyard. We did have a few issues putting it together however as some of the screw hole did not line up and we had to drill a few new ones but over all that was a minor problem.
customer_reviews.author: A. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Nice height garden bed
customer_reviews.text: We did a bunch of research trying to pick a raised bed for our backyard garden. My wife and her bad knees didn't want to get on the ground. We picked the VegTrug and so far it seems to be a good choice. The youtube video on the construction is a must because the instructions included in the box are different and seemingly more difficult. There was several comments in previous reviews regarding the quality of the wood. We had two boards that were very slightly warped and in attempting to tighten the screw, the board split slightly. A bit of wood glue and some gentle tightening and all seems to be good.
customer_reviews.author: KNBishop

customer_reviews.title: I love these planters
customer_reviews.text: Begged my husband for the first two because I was tired of finding rattle snakes in my garden. Just brought this third one without consulting anyone. My first two are about 8 years old. I need to give them a little love, but they continue to provide great service......without snakes.
customer_reviews.author: E. Neilsen

customer_reviews.title: Looks Good!
customer_reviews.text: VegTrug is fairly easy to assemble, though the YouTube video is helpful. I received 2 pieces of wood that were badly split & unusable, so I had to spend some time working around that. Disappointing considering the cost. You never know what you are going to find (or not find) in a flat pack box. Other than that, it looks good & sturdy. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Matthias !

customer_reviews.title: Follow the instructions and you'll be happy
customer_reviews.text: The most important thing is to follow the instructions, especially when they say to only hand tighten the bolts until it's all together. Also, make sure that when you are assembling the top portion to do it upside down on a flat surface. The video I saw says to assemble the top on the body. It works out much better doing it upside down and then flipping it and placing it on the body. I haven't actually used it yet, as I just assembled it in mid-September, past the growing season. I do have friends that are totally satisfied growing crops in the VegTrug.
customer_reviews.author: SJG

customer_reviews.title: Good Value, Sturdy, Easy to Assemble
customer_reviews.text: Saw this from various sources, but Amazon's price and delivery time was better than anyone else. Easy for two people to assemble in less than an hour, very sturdy design and materials, well thought out. I especially like the ample dimensions and counter-height of the medium size. The height makes it very easy to work in without kneeling, stooping or bending. Recommend that buyers visit the VegTrug website for a 3 minute video that will make assembly easy to understand and accomplish. By the way, it takes about 11-12 cubic feet of soil to fill up what VegTrug calls the medium size to within 6 inches of the top.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: and the Fir wood smells fantastic - it's a beautiful addition to any patio or ...
customer_reviews.text: Assembly is much easier than other similar products, with clearly labeled and numbered screws in an organizer, rather than just jumbled in a plastic bag. The height is just right to work with without stooping, and the Fir wood smells fantastic - it's a beautiful addition to any patio or garden.
customer_reviews.author: thurmond

customer_reviews.title: Neat little garden
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my wife for Mother's Day. It showed up in a big box with wood, crews, and instructions. The instructions were pretty good and I put it together in a couple of hours. Though the wood is pretty light the box garden seems pretty sturdy. I put the lining in, we filled it with soil and planted some tomatoes and cucumbers. So far everything's coming along nicely. I like the V shape as it allows room for rooting plants.
customer_reviews.author: Bret Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent raised planter. And I love the smell of the cedar!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in spite of some reviewers saying they got split wood, and mine came with all pieces intact. I did the assembly by myself in about 40 minutes (an electric drill helps a lot!). We dumped in some dirt and put in some plants and seeds, and so far everything is pretty much perfect. I've only had it a couple weeks, but the wood is solid and I fully expect it to last for many years. No problems here.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Lingner

customer_reviews.title: I love the VegTrug!
customer_reviews.text: The VegTrug is fantastic! My mother wanted a garden inside our screen porch and now she has it! We are growing tomatoes, peas, squash, zucchini, lettuce, radishes, carrots, and strawberries all in this one planter. Absolutely amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Kenny

customer_reviews.title: So Happy I got this VegTrug
customer_reviews.text: The best planter I've found! I will happily use the VegTrug year after year. My housemate assembled it and had to get some hardware from the local hardware store to make it work and I think he had to make one hole bigger but it did work and I have a very effective and successful tool for planting and growing many plants. I have bad knees and can't be on the ground gardening so this is ideal.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product except
customer_reviews.text: Good product. Goes together fairly easily. Squaring up everything is a bit tricky but it eventually worked. I watched a video on the gardeners supply website, which was very helpful. The reason for the 4 star and not 5 is that front panel where the trademark title is was split and I do not see a way to contact customer service about it. If that piece was replaced this would be a 5 star for me.
customer_reviews.author: Red Frames

customer_reviews.title: Good design, soft wood
customer_reviews.text: The design of this product is very good but the materials don't justify its price. The wood is extremely soft, almost cardboard, to the point that the screws wouldn't grip reliably. I had to repair some of the pre-assembled parts and use some different fasteners. That said, once it is assembled it seems to be structurally adequate.
customer_reviews.author: Professor John

customer_reviews.title: Love the Veg Trug
customer_reviews.text: We love the Veg Trug. It is great for older folks because they don't have to bend over so much. Putting it together went quickly and smoothly. It is planted with 5 different veggie and is perfect for our needs. Will probably get one more next year. Make sure you get the coverings. Have the plastic covering with frame but waiting on the micromesh covering to arrive.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Great for setting up your vegetable garden in a small ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased a few months ago. Great for setting up your vegetable garden in a small space. If you follow the directions, it is very easy to assemble. Keep all fittings loose until it is all assembled is the key. Veggies in full growth right now. Will update when it's harvest time
customer_reviews.author: CPS

customer_reviews.title: Good design poorly implemented
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed with the quality of the wood; lots of knots and some splitting. Better quality wood was expected considering the price. There is a lot of screwing into end grain which is not so good especially with this poor wood.Assembly was a little tricky but manageable.
customer_reviews.author: Art Mensch

customer_reviews.title: One Unit Arrived Damaged
customer_reviews.text: Purchased two units. First was in good condition and online video was helpful in assembly, but it is definitely a two person operation. Second was damaged likely during manufacturing since there was no damage to the box (see photos). Since I was unwilling to ship it back I repaired the splintered parts, but completing assembly after making repairs was problematic with obvious warped pieces and fit not as precise.
customer_reviews.author: ARJAY

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: I really do like this but it was warped or bent when we got it and does not seem super sturdy. I will see how it holds up in our Arizona sun.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: A wonderful gardening setup!
customer_reviews.text: What a treat! This is an ideal item for gardeners with back issues or any mobility issues, to be sure! I cannot recommend this more highly for the hobbyist or the green thumb. I only gave it four stars for ease of assembly as I am an avid assembler of things around the house, however, I do believe it may prove challenging for those not accustomed to putting things together. (If you have issues with IKEA instructions, you may struggle a wee bit with this, but it is so worth it!)
customer_reviews.author: theoceanpeach

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality wood
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these. Both had split pieces of wood. One was beyond my husbands repair. We sent it back. We again were disappointed with the return product....they simply put WoodGlue on the split boards and sanded and shipped back. I was extremely disappointed considering the price of these raised beds.
customer_reviews.author: Katie turner

customer_reviews.title: Unfortunately damaged
customer_reviews.text: I needed a way to have a small garden. Having a raised one was ideal. I saw this on another site and it looked to fit my need. It should meet my needs. Unfortunately, the product came with a split support board. I was so disappointed. My only option was to return it. There was not a way to just get a replacement piece. It is big and heavy and almost assembled. I’m going to have to keep it and find a way to fix the support. Many people have had better luck with the product they received. Just be aware the wood is balsam wood.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy Uselton

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy used!
customer_reviews.text: What I love about the product it’s big enough to store a good array of veggies and it fits on my porch nicely. However when it arrived it had a lot of split panels where it fits together, almost all of them! I had my sisters fiancé put together and he was able to rig it to fit together, however by next summer all of those panels will need to be replaced. Due to size and packaging I kept and made it work as I actually love the size and overall design. I would not buy used again, would recommend buying a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great and as described
customer_reviews.text: Works great and as described. Love the liner. When we have a rain storm I don't need to worry about plants being over watered. I wasn't sure how much would fit in it. I planted green, red, and hot peppers, carrots, five spinach plants, cilantro, basil, oregano, garlic, onions. Highly recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Nyg

customer_reviews.title: out of the box and chunks of wood are chipped remind whatever carrier you use to handle with care!
customer_reviews.text: you probably need to remind whatever carrier you use to use more care in handling this type of mdse s it came with gaping holes on either side of the box with chunks of wood pieces missing. its to humbug to send back!
customer_reviews.author: Anson Piimauna

customer_reviews.title: 2nd one
customer_reviews.text: Since my husband has trouble walking and bending this is perfect for him. We fit our entire garden (except for the squash and pumpkins) in the 2 of them. The tomatoes, peppers, lettuce and spinach came out plentiful and perfect.
customer_reviews.author: C. Klatt

customer_reviews.title: Great garden bed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my dad who loves to garden but physically can't bend over anymore. The bed is nice and deep for root veggies and drains well. Sturdy product was not too difficult to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: DeirdreMcKee

customer_reviews.title: Just as described
customer_reviews.text: It took exactly nine bags of potting soil. Really easy to assemble. We found a video on how best to put it together, it made our lives much easier. The directions that came with it didn't talk about a rubber mallet that you will need.
customer_reviews.author: ShoesAholic

customer_reviews.title: Truly perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Super happy with this purchase! Especially since it was so much less than everywhere else was selling it for. Looking forward to growing our leafy greens in this.
customer_reviews.author: Miss H L Brown

customer_reviews.title: Durable and nice looking
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for several years and it still looks great! Plants do very well in this
customer_reviews.author: Tammy

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy,easy assembly with one person, just the right height and my peppers and tomatoes are just starting to ripen. Wish they had one about 2 feet longer. Hope that it lasts in this AZ heat
customer_reviews.author: Martin H JacobyTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Low quality, not worth the price
customer_reviews.text: The product quality is not worth the amount paid for. There are multiple places that doesn’t connect well and lots of split open within the wood quality. The manufacturer really need to do a better quality control.
customer_reviews.author: C.P

customer_reviews.title: VegTrug
customer_reviews.text: Item is as described. Easy to assemble, have a lot of compliments. I’m excited for the weather to get warmer so I can start planting my garden.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy

customer_reviews.title: I did not receive my liner with this product :(
customer_reviews.text: I did not receive my liner with this product :( Other than that its a good product.
customer_reviews.author: steven seuss

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together. Looks great. I have sprouts already!
customer_reviews.author: Lori K. Bigler

customer_reviews.title: That all promises are kept.
customer_reviews.text: The Veg Trug is attractive, sturdy, and as advertised. I would highly recommend to anyone interested in a back saving planter.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Schmucker

customer_reviews.title: Missing a crucial bolt...
customer_reviews.text: We are missing a bolt. It can't be put together properly without this piece.
customer_reviews.author: VanityFair

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in my purchase, not the quality piece I expected.
customer_reviews.text: Received my Vegtrug today, and assembly was rather simple. However, My biggest complaint is the branded Vegtrug board split while assembling. There is also a lot of wood filler on the end pieces. Not sure who to contact about replacement boards.
customer_reviews.author: Indyguypx

customer_reviews.title: ... I tried to install it and it has very poor instruction manual
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I tried to install it and it has very poor instruction manual. Also, the materials were really bad and did not fit together well. We had both something similar from a different site a few years ago and the quality was way better.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely perfect!! Very sturdy and will hold a ton of veggies! Very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Stacey Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Easy on the back.
customer_reviews.text: Love this. I don't have to garden on my knees and I can protect my veggies from the deer.
customer_reviews.author: Dorothy L. Clarkin

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Easy to assemble and is very sturdy. Purchased for my 90 year young mother who loves to garden but not able to get on her knees to weed - LOL No weeding needed with this wonderful planter and she truly enjoys it. Already referring friends and family to this item.
customer_reviews.author: Minne_Sota

customer_reviews.title: Product performed as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Ordered 2 as a gift and they went over very well. A second set of hands is helpful and Ikea level assembly required.
customer_reviews.author: donald

customer_reviews.title: After some sawing, it finally fit
customer_reviews.text: had to saw a couple boards to fit together. DO NOT BUY THE MESH INSECT COVER!!!!
customer_reviews.author: fightingterp

customer_reviews.title: This elevated planter is fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a birthday gift for my daughter and she loves it. Her three year old enjoys taking care of the herbs and veggies as much as her Mommy does!
customer_reviews.author: NancyL33565

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The product turned out to be excellent, but UPS screwed up the delivery
customer_reviews.author: Alan R. Fleishman

customer_reviews.title: cracks in two legs or would have been 5 star
customer_reviews.text: two of the legs has small cracks in the wood. Can't really reach company to get replacements.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broken
customer_reviews.text: Both side panels are broken and unusable. Impossible to contact Amazon. The only option for a refund or a replacement is to send this very voluminous package back. Right now with a mandatory "stay home" in our town it is impossible.
customer_reviews.author: Philippe Lasserre

customer_reviews.title: Assembly
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to assemble. Less than an hour and no cussing by hubby! Very srurdy
customer_reviews.author: Mimi

customer_reviews.title: Garden box
customer_reviews.text: The Garddn Box was exactly what my wife wanted for her Birthday. It was super easy to assemble. It took me 30 minutes to put together. My only beef with this purchase is it cost. They sell the assembled version in Nurseries for less.
customer_reviews.author: Edward M Dwyer

customer_reviews.title: Strong buy
customer_reviews.text: Loving this planter! Looks great, perfect size and it’s well made.
customer_reviews.author: B. Helfand

customer_reviews.title: Love this raised bed
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this raised bed. Very reasonably priced compared to similar items. I can bend or stoop and these are perfect for my garden.
customer_reviews.author: SA Mom

customer_reviews.title: Fine quality.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality. Perfect for my use in a limited space. Heartily recommend.
customer_reviews.author: John R.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking, sturdy. Cuts down on critter destruction. Varying depths accomodates a range of produce.
customer_reviews.author: Erin S.

customer_reviews.title: We bought two of them and they are great! All the parts were in the box and ...
customer_reviews.text: We bought two of them and they are great! All the parts were in the box and they went together so easily. We added a drip irrigation system and the plants are very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Vevig

customer_reviews.title: Cheap materials for a no so cheap price.
customer_reviews.text: The idea is great for someone like me with disabilities. However, if you know someone with woodworking tools, pay them to make one for you. Very cheap material. Splits no matter how easy you work it. Doesn't fit well either. I was looking for one made with metal and having wheels but couldn't find it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to construct and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Growing some vegetables in this. Easy to construct and sturdy. Soil stays in the black liner and water drips out the bottom through the liner. Hope the wood holds up for future years.
customer_reviews.author: bottlecap

customer_reviews.title: it was very easy to put
customer_reviews.text: cant wait to do the planting. it was very easy to put together
customer_reviews.author: Trudy Tolbert

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Well made and hubby said easily assembled. Our garden is doing really well. Love!
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Would definitely buy again
customer_reviews.text: This product is well made and looks great! My veggies are growing nicely!
customer_reviews.author: Billie S.

customer_reviews.title: Love my vegetable garden!
customer_reviews.text: I had no problem putting it together. I love the size, I love the shape, I love that it’s the perfect height and I love that the bunnies can’t get to it!
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: I found this very easy and quick to put together. Would have been quicker if I would have had the cordless drill charged up. There are a lot of screws and I don't recommend just using a screwdriver. The leg caps did seem loose and I worried about water collecting in them so I put some silicon seal inside of them and put them back on and ran a small bead around the top of each cap. It is doing well with 2 tomato plants and 5 pepper plants, a row on each side of beets and radishes will be done before the larger plants crowd them out.
customer_reviews.author: LJA

customer_reviews.title: Great so far
customer_reviews.text: Great so far was easy to put together would of good if it was fully predrilled but I took care of that. Look like quality wood was used. Will see how it holds up might stain it in the fall to make it last longer
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Stirewalt

customer_reviews.title: It is easy to assembly, looks great and works
customer_reviews.text: I liked everything about this bed and plan to get another one after the first of the year.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: raised bed
customer_reviews.text: The raised bed is an excellent choice especially for accessibility and no weeding.
customer_reviews.author: scenic haj

customer_reviews.title: It's a great garden
customer_reviews.text: Love my vegtrugs I have two of them there is easy to plant my vegetables in them.
customer_reviews.author: Judy Bohnen

customer_reviews.title: Salad greens until Easter!
customer_reviews.text: Loved it. This my second one, at different addresses, and two as gifts. They are great. Made of good wood, lining lasts for two years, shade cloth works fine as replacement. Salad greens until Easter!
customer_reviews.author: Susanne M.

customer_reviews.title: Great gift idea for mom
customer_reviews.text: Assembly was easy. We bought the recommended soil and the plants are growing up so fast. My mom was so excited to try the veg trug.
customer_reviews.author: Letitia Heckenberg

customer_reviews.title: Glad I found this!!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love love love this raised bed! This season I wasn’t sure I could have a vegetable garden due to back issues. I decided to try this and it worked out great. It is everything I hoped for and more. Easy to assemble and good quality. Thank you so much!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Convenient to planting and maintaining st waist level
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great garden for my patio!
customer_reviews.text: Have a great garden growing on my back patio thanks to Vegtrug. Not all the parts lined up exactly but it seems to be working and the overlaps of wood are barely noticeable. Definitely a two person job to finish (though I did most of it myself). Didn't take as much dirt as it said on the website. Only needed 5 bags of potting soil and not 7.
customer_reviews.author: H. A. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!! Hugh tomatoes!!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together, high quality. Tomatoes are three feet high already!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Bastian

customer_reviews.title: Have just planted seeds, no results yet. It ...
customer_reviews.text: Have just planted seeds, no results yet. It is well built, is at a Very convenient height, fits in well with my other planters
customer_reviews.author: Jo Ann Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great for a small porch garden. Can’t wait to eat fresh tomatoes.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Backes

customer_reviews.title: Flourishing!
customer_reviews.text: It offers a lot of space for vegetables and herbs - ours is packed to the brim!
customer_reviews.author: ZB

customer_reviews.title: Great way to garden
customer_reviews.text: It was not hard to put together but we did have to drill a few new holes. Our plants are doing fantastic. And there are no weeds!
customer_reviews.author: Karen Arndt

customer_reviews.title: Slight issues but  still worth it.
customer_reviews.text: High quality and as advertised, but design has slight issues- the top side-boards don't always line up with the ends to the point where you can screw into them properly. The 'V' structure varies in width and this can push the long side boards out to where you can't reach them. I cut ~3" pieces off of a 2x4 to reinforce the corners and give me something to screw into. Even with this flaw, I bought 2 more after the first one because they're still great. Garden is in full production now and I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: Tracey Chavers

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: easy to put together excellent product this is my second one
customer_reviews.author: Susan Spaw

customer_reviews.title: Well made, easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Well made, easy to install. I did put several coats of water seal on it, seems like a very porus wood.
customer_reviews.author: montanatom

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: Excellent value. Recommend the cover green house and shade as well
customer_reviews.author: Rodney Sarauw

customer_reviews.title: Made my wife happy.
customer_reviews.text: Assembled with ease. All parts lined up with no problem. Quality materials. Made my wife happy.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Skidmore

customer_reviews.title: WRONG SIZE LINER
customer_reviews.text: liner is to small. wrong size liner. need correct size liner ASAP
customer_reviews.author: Chief Warrant Officer Retired

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together and so easy to work with the plants!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: This garden box was exactly what I wanted. It ...
customer_reviews.text: This garden box was exactly what I wanted. It was a lot bigger than I expected. My husband put it together for me and filled it with dirt. I can't wait to use it this summer!
customer_reviews.author: Amy M McCormack

customer_reviews.title: ... mother who cannot bend over to garden and she loved it. I am going to buy a few ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my mother who cannot bend over to garden and she loved it. I am going to buy a few for myself as well.
customer_reviews.author: Tina H.

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: It's wonderful. Relatively easy to assemble. It holds more than you can imagine! It looks great in the garden too. And No bending down or bending over, a real plus for people with back problems at any age. I'm going back to order the cover.
customer_reviews.author: katherine lenehan

customer_reviews.title: disappointed with quality and follow-on
customer_reviews.text: Box arrived damaged with scratches to product. Assembled per instructions sides were not square and one end on each protrudes despite effoert to push in ans square. Predrilled holes on ends were off thus screw protrudes into bed which will cut liner. Contacted company provides photos and they said they would take 1-2 days to remedy. After a week they replied with "it was put together wrong you didn't follow instructions." Said I could send it back and they may credit me if they find defect. Not a reasonable response. Keeping it but will look elsewhere for my next purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Terry

customer_reviews.title: So excited
customer_reviews.text: I received my Veg Trug last night and am so excited to get it planted. It is just what I was hoping it would be. The size is perfect, the appearance and quality of this item exceed my expectations. My husband states it was easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: David L Stelzer

customer_reviews.title: Nice but not great quality
customer_reviews.text: One of the wood slats on the side came out of the box with the screws stripped and falling off. Didn't seem worth the hassle of returning so we reattached it using new holes but I'm not optimistic given how soft the wood is. Will update if it doesn't hold.
customer_reviews.author: David Urban

customer_reviews.title: well made
customer_reviews.text: Well made sturdy and functions well. Now if I can only get rid of the critters who are eating my plants
customer_reviews.author: Terry Ray

customer_reviews.title: Not so hot
customer_reviews.text: It was awful trying to put this thing together. The video made it look easy, however, it was not. I had to get a drill in order to finish it! I recommend checking out the other elevated garden the one with no tools needed.
customer_reviews.author: Foi Mac

customer_reviews.title: A+++++ Nice planter! Easy assembly with two of us
customer_reviews.text: A+++++ Nice planter! Easy assembly with two of us. Pieces accurately cut and drilled. All the hardware was there plus two extra screws. We're happy. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: mel0789

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love this planter. Resulted in a lot of fresh vegies.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel K. Roh

customer_reviews.title: buy it
customer_reviews.text: Great way to grow a garden in a limited space. Easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: box mountain

customer_reviews.title: Awesome raised bed
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to compliment our square raised beds and to plant squash and zucchini in. The height makes it perfect to check for squash bugs and to keep an eye on those quickly growing zukes. It looks great in our garden and has been awesome so far. It's a little awkward to put together but only took about 20-30 minutes by myself. If I had a second pair of hands, it probably would have gone together in 10-15. Highly recommend using a drill as there are a lot of screws, especially when attaching the side panels.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan

product_meta.title: VegTrug 1.8 Meter Raised Bed
product_meta.description: Size:1-(Pack)The Vegtrug raised bed planter has enough room to grownup to 30 salads & vegetables at any one time on the patio, or in the garden with this great space-saving growing solution. You can grow all kinds of fruit & vegetables in your Vegtrug medium wooden planter with fittings to attach netting & fleece easily to protect your crops from frost & pests. The easy build design means it arrives in one box with easy to follow instructions. You can also watch our online build video on your tablet or other media device. The Vegtrug is made from sustainable sources, comes with a purpose built, replaceable fitted membrane liner, keeping in the compost & with perforations to give good draining. This Vegtrug is easy to work with; no more bending or kneeling & ideal for the elderly & wheelchair users.
feature_bullets: Easy working height. No more bending or kneeling. Ideal for the elderly and wheelchair users
The medium 1.8 Vegtrug will hold 7 (60L) bags of compost
Can be easily netted or covered If necessary
